alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Coweta; Douglas; Heard; South Fulton (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 26 at 9:18PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Carroll, southwestern Douglas, northeastern Heard, northwestern Coweta and southwestern Fulton Counties through 945 PM EDT... At 918 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was over Plant Wansley, or 9 miles northeast of Franklin, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind, up to penny sized hail and frequent cloud to ground lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Newnan, Whitesburg, Centralhatchee, Roopville, Chattahoochee Hills, Plant Yates, Byers Crossroads, Hannah, Arnco-Sargent, Powers Crossroads, Seaton Lake, Fairplay, Handy, Dunaway Gardens, Clem, Lowell, Plant Wansley, Treasure Lake, Roscoe and Madras. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 AM EDT for north central, northwestern and west central Georgia.

area.areaDesc: Carroll; Coweta; Douglas; Heard; South Fulton
